item.name: serviceCDP
item.fixImpact: The NMS could stop gathering information from this device
item.threatInfo: Someone could leak information network topology
item.howtofix:
Run the command "no cdp run" to globally disable CDP. Or, run the "no cdp enable" command on the following interfaces if they are not needed: [%CdpifsEnabled].
CDP protocol is already disabled on those interfaces: [%CdpifsDisabled].
item.upgrade: Current IOS version disable this feature by default

item.name: serviceLLDP
item.fixImpact: The NMS could stop gathering information from this device
item.threatInfo: Someone could leak information network topology
item.howtofix:
Run the command "no lldp run" to globally disable LLDP. Or, Run the "no lldp transmit" commands on the following interfaces if they are not needed: [%LldpEnabledTx].
Run the "no lldp receive" commands on the following interfaces if they are not needed: [%LldpEnabledRx].
LLDP protocol is already disabled on those interfaces: [%LldpifsDisabled].
item.upgrade: Current IOS version disable this feature by default

item.name: auxExecTimeout
item.threatInfo: Someone could type commands when you aren't in front of the aux port
item.howtofix:
(config)# line aux 0 (config-line)# exec-timeout 0 10
The 0 is in minutes and 10 in seconds. The exec-timeout value must be between 0 1 and 2 59.

item.threatInfo: Someone could connect physically and acces device configuration through aux port
item.howtofix: (config)# line aux 0 (config-line)# transport input none

item.name: auxTransportOutput

item.howtofix: (config)# line aux 0 (config-line)# transport output none

item.name: auxNoExec

item.howtofix: (config)# line aux 0 (config-line)# no exec

item.name: vtyExecTimeout
item.threatInfo: Someone could type commands when you aren't in front of the vty port
item.howtofix:
(config)# line vty [%vtySessionNumbers] (config-line)# exec-timeout 0 10
In the above example, the 0 is in minutes and 10 in seconds. Exec-timeout value must be between 0 1 and 2 59.

item.name: vtyIPv4AccessClass
item.threatInfo: Someone could connect physically and acces others devices through vty port
item.howtofix:
(config)# ip access-list extended remote-mgmt-aclv4 (config-ext-acl)# remark allow login only to loopback0 (config-ext-acl)# permit tcp [%ManagementSubnet] [%ManagementWildcardMask] any eq telnet log (config-ext-acl)# permit tcp [%ManagementSubnet] [%ManagementWildcardMask] any eq 22 log (config-ext-acl)# deny tcp any any log (config-ext-acl)# exit
(config)# line vty [%vtySessionNumbers] (config-line)# transport input ssh telnet (config-line)# access-class remote-mgmt-aclv4 in

item.name: vtyIPv6AccessClass
item.threatInfo: Someone could connect physically and acces others devices through vty port
item.howtofix:
(config)# ipv6 access-list remote-mgmt-aclv6 (config-ipv6-acl)# remark allow login only to loopback0 (config-ipv6-acl)# permit tcp 2001:db8:61::/64 host 2001:db8:6f::ee15:f00d log-input (config-ipv6-acl)# permit tcp 2001:db8:60::/64 host 2001:db8:6f::ee15:f00d log-input (config-ipv6-acl)# deny ipv6 any any log-input (config-ipv6-acl)# exit
(config)# line vty [%vtySessionNumbers] (config-line)# transport output ssh (config-line)# ipv6 access-class remote-mgmt-aclv6 in

item.name: snmpVersion3
item.definition: Authentication and/or crypto on SNMP packets
item.threatInfo: Someone could intercept and read SNMP packets if version 3 is not enabled.
item.howtofix:
You need to create a SNMPv3 group and a user/password credential.
Authentication and privacy: (config)# snmp-server group AUTHGROUP v3 priv (config)# snmp-server user snmpv3user PRIVGROUP v3 auth md5 authpassword priv 3des
Or, only authentication:
(config)# snmp-server group AUTHGROUP v3 auth (config)# snmp-server user snmpv3user PRIVGROUP v3 auth md5 authpassword

item.name: ipICMPunreachable
item.threatInfo: It can increase CPU utilization.
item.howtofix:
IP ICMP unreachable should be removed on those interfaces by typing "no ip unreachables": [%UnreachableifsEnabled].
IP ICMP unreachable are already disabled on those interfaces: [%UnreachableifsDisabled].
Or, rate-limit ICMP unreachable messages from the global configuration: (config)# ip icmp rate-limit unreachable 250

item.name: proxyArp
item.definition: No reply to packets that are intended for another device
item.threatInfo: Utilizing proxy ARP can result in an increase in the amount of ARP traffic on the network segment and resource exhaustion and man-in-the-middle attacks.
item.howtofix:
ARP proxy should be removed on those interfaces by typing "no ip proxy-arp": [%ArpifsEnabled].
ARP proxy are already disabled on those interfaces: [%ArpifsDisabled].

item.name: ntpAuthentication
item.threatInfo: Some evil hacker could easily craft NTP packets without this option.
item.howtofix:
Enable NTP authentication: (config)# ntp authenticate
Configure the MD5 key (8 characters max.):
(config)# ntp authentication-key 10 md5 S3CUr1Ty

item.name: bgpTTLsecurity

item.howtofix:
It must be done for all the neighbors.
(config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 ttl-security hops 2

item.name: bgpMaxASlimit

item.howtofix: (config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# bgp maxas-limit 5

item.name: bgpSessionPassword

item.name: bgpMaxPrefixes

(config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 maximum-prefix 1000 30

item.threatInfo: Someone could inject unneeded BGP prefixes.
item.howtofix:
It must be done on all the neighbors and in both direction: In and Out. If there are too many prefixes to list then only filter the RFC3330 prefixes.
(config)# ip prefix-list PREFIXLISTIN seq 5 permit 0.0.0.0/0 (config)# ip prefix-list PREFIXLISTOUT seq 5 permit 192.168.2.0/24 (config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 prefix-list PREFIXLISTIN in (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 prefix-list PREFIXLISTOUT out

item.name: bgpiACL

item.howtofix: (config)# ip access-list extended Infrastructure-ACL-Policy (config-acl)# permit tcp host 192.0.2.2 host 192.0.2.1 eq bgp (config-acl)# permit tcp host 192.0.2.2 eq bgp host 192.0.2.1 (config-acl)# deny tcp any any eq bgp (config-acl)# deny tcp any eq bgp any

item.name: bgpaspathList

(config)# ip as-path access-list 1 permit ^65501$ (config)# ip as-path access-list 2 permit ^$ (config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 filter-list 1 in (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 filter-list 2 out

item.name: IPoptions
item.threatInfo: IP options are managed by CPU and could subvert traffic path.
item.howtofix: (config)# ip options drop

item.name: IPsourceroute
item.threatInfo: This functionality can be used in attempts to route traffic around security controls in the network.
item.howtofix: (config)# no ip source-route

item.name: ipICMPredirects
item.threatInfo: This behavior allows the sender to bypass the router and forward future packets directly to the destination (or to a router closer to the destination).
item.howtofix:
IP ICMP redirects should be removed on those interfaces by typing "no ip redirects": [%RedirectifsEnabled].
IP ICMP redirects are already disabled on those interfaces: [%RedirectifsDisabled].

item.name: ICMPdeny
item.threatInfo: Some ICMP messages are useful but external ICMP connectivity is rarely needed.
item.howtofix: (config)# ip access-list extended ACL-TRANSIT-IN (config-ext-nacl)# permit icmp host 'trusted-networks' any (config-ext-nacl)# deny icmp any any

item.name: IPfrags
item.threatInfo: Fragmentation is also often used in attempts to evade detection by intrusion detection systems.
item.howtofix: (config)# ip access-list extended ACL-TRANSIT-IN (config-ext-nacl)# deny tcp any any fragments (config-ext-nacl)# deny udp any any fragments (config-ext-nacl)# deny icmp any any fragments (config-ext-nacl)# deny ip any any fragments

item.name: urpf
item.threatInfo: IP address spoofing.
item.howtofix:
(config)# ip cef (config)# interface 'interface' (config-if)# ip verify unicast source reachable-via any
Interfaces needed to be fixed are the following: [%URPFCandidates].

item.name: urpfv6
item.threatInfo: IP address spoofing.
item.howtofix:
(config)# ip cef (config)# interface 'interface' (config-if)# ipv6 enable (config-if)# ipv6 verify unicast source reachable-via [rx|any]
Interfaces needed to be fixed are the following: [%URPFv6Candidates].

item.name: portsecuritySticky
item.threatInfo: blarg.
item.howtofix: (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# switchport port-security mac-address sticky

item.name: portsecurityMaximumTotal

item.name: portsecurityMaximumAccess
item.threatInfo: blarg.
item.howtofix: (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# switchport port-security maximum 1 vlan access

item.name: portsecurityMaximumVoice
item.threatInfo: blarg.
item.howtofix: (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# switchport port-security maximum 2 vlan voice

item.name: IPv6rh0
item.threatInfo: This functionality can be used in attempts to route traffic around security controls in the network.
item.howtofix:
(config)# no ipv6 source-route
Or ipv6 access-list DENY-IPv6-TYPE0-RH deny ipv6 any any routing-type 0 interface GigabitEthernet0/0 // on every interface with IPv6 enabled. ipv6 enable ipv6 traffic-filter DENY-IPv6-TYPE0-RH in

item.name: IPSECcacIKE
item.definition: IPSEC IKE SA call admission control
item.threatInfo: IPSEC resources exhaustion.
item.howtofix: (config)# crypto call admission limit ike sa 25

item.name: IPSECcacRSC
item.threatInfo: IPSEC resources exhaustion.
item.howtofix: (config)# call admission limit 9000

item.name: nonegotiate
item.threatInfo: A port could be converted to a trunk port glad to DTP protocol default behavior.
item.howtofix: (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# switchport nonegotiate

item.name: flowcontrol
item.threatInfo: 802.3x quanta packets can lead to a denial of service attack if transmitted permanently.
item.howtofix: (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# flowcontrol receive off

item.name: udld
item.threatInfo: UDLD consumes bandwidth and CPU so must be disabled globally and enabled per interface onyl when needed.
item.howtofix: (config)# no udld enable

item.name: vlan1
item.threatInfo: A specific VLAN must be used for out-of-band management. VLAN 1 could be span all over the network if not pruned correctly.
item.howtofix: (config)# vlan 6 (config-vlan)# name ADMINISTRATION-VLAN (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# description Out-Of-Band Admin (config-if)# switchport mode access (config-if)# switchport access vlan 6 (config-if)# no shutdown

item.name: unusedports
item.threatInfo: If an unused port is enable by an attacker it could lead to non-authorized access on the network.
item.howtofix: # vlan 999 (vlan)# name *** BIT BUCKET for unused ports *** (vlan)# shutdown (vlan)# exit (config)# interface [%interface] (config-if)# switchport mode access (config-if)# switchport access vlan 999 (config-if)# shutdown

item.name: vtpsecure
item.threatInfo: It prevents unauthorized switches to add themselves to the VTP domain.
item.howtofix: (config)# vtp domain test.lab (config)# vtp password g00d-P5WD (config)# vtp pruning

item.name: bpduguard
item.threatInfo: It prevents a malicious user to connect a switch on a switch port.
item.howtofix: (config)# spanning-tree portfast bpduguard default (config)# errdisable recovery cause bpduguard (config)# errdisable recovery interval 400

item.name: stproot
item.threatInfo: It prevents an unauthorized to become STP root and leak the traffic.
item.howtofix: Configuration that must be applied for relevant interfaces which must not becomes STP root: (config-if)# spanning-tree guard root

item.name: dot1x
item.threatInfo: It prevents an unauthorized and uncontrolled user to connect to the network.
item.howtofix: (config)# aaa authentication dot1x default group radius (config)# dot1x system-auth-control (config)# interface 'interface' (config-if)# dot1x port-control auto (config-if)# ...

item.name: netflowV9
item.definition: Exporting network flows for security monitoring
item.threatInfo: Network attacks could not be detected appropriately if security monitoring is not used.
item.howtofix: (config)# ip flow-capture fragment-offset (config)# ip flow-capture icmp (config)# ip flow-capture ip-id (config)# ip flow-capture mac-addresses (config)# ip flow-capture packet-length (config)# ip flow-capture ttl (config)# ip flow-capture vlan-id (config)# interface 'interface' (on every interface that must be monitored) (config-if)# ip flow ingress (or/and ip flow egress)
